alert.note: Alert for Blount; Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:16PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Blount, northern Calhoun, Etowah, northeastern St. Clair and Cherokee Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 116 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Little River Falls to near Tabor Road to near Allgood. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Jacksonville, Rainbow City, Oneonta, Attalla, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Cleveland, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Glencoe, Ashville, Sardis City, Locust Fork, Ohatchee, Steele and Leesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central and northeastern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Blount; Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah; St. Clair
